      • setApplicationId

        public void setApplicationId(java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Set Application's ID The Id can be one of them:
        Start with "~" : which means this application will use some Flint internal specific features.
        Not start with "~" : Standard DIAL application ID.
        Specified by:
        setApplicationId in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        id - Application ID

                                         java.lang.String namespace,
                                         java.lang.String message)

        Send one message to the current connected receiver application.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        namespace - the dest namespace.
        message - message which will be sent
        Returns:
        pending result which can be used to see whether the message has been enqueued to be sent to a Flint device.

        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        url - the url of the receiver application to launch.
        relaunchIfRunning - If true, relaunch the application if it is already running.

      • launchApplication

                                                                          boolean relaunchIfRunning,
                                                                          boolean useIpc)
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Launch a receiver application
        Specified by:
        launchApplication in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        url - the url of the receiver application to launch.
        relaunchIfRunning - If true, relaunch the application if it is already running.
        useIpc - If true, use websocket to connect receiver.
        Returns:
        launch's pending result which can be used to retrieve connection information.

      • joinApplication

        public PendingResult<Flint.ApplicationConnectionResult> joinApplication(FlintManager manager,
                                                                        java.lang.String url)
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Join to the current running receiver application. The previous PendingResult will be canceled with the Flint.ApplicationConnectionResult's status code being CANCELED.
        Specified by:
        joinApplication in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        url - the url of the receiver application to join.
        Returns:
        join's pending result which can be used to retrieve connection information.

      • leaveApplication

        public PendingResult<Status> leaveApplication(FlintManager manager)
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Disconnect from receiver application If there is no currently active application session, this method does nothing. If this method is called while stopApplication(FlintManager) is pending, then this method does nothing. The Status's status code will be INVALID_REQUEST.
        Specified by:
        leaveApplication in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        Returns:
        leave's pending result which can be used to retrieve if the command was successful.

      • stopApplication

        public PendingResult<Status> stopApplication(FlintManager manager)
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Stops any running receiver application(s) If this method is called while leaveApplication(FlintManager) is pending, then this method does nothing. The Status's status code will be INVALID_REQUEST.
        Specified by:
        stopApplication in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        Returns:
        stop's pending result which can be used to retrieve if the command was successful.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(FlintManager manager,
                      double volume)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Set device's volume If volume is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0], then the value will be clipped.
        Specified by:
        setVolume in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        volume - volume level, in the range [0.0, 1.0].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is no active service connection.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the volume is infinity or NaN.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If an I/O error occurs while performing the request.

      • setMessageReceivedCallbacks

        public void setMessageReceivedCallbacks(FlintManager manager,
                                        java.lang.String namespace,
                                        Flint.MessageReceivedCallback callbacks)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Set callback function when received messages on the specific namespace The new listener will replace an existing listener for a given namespace. Messages received by the controller for the given namespace will be forwarded to this listener. The caller must have already called connect() and received onConnected(Bundle) callback.
        Specified by:
        setMessageReceivedCallbacks in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        namespace - used namespace of the Flint channel.
        callbacks - callback function
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while performing the request.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when the controller is not connected to a FlintDevice.

      • removeMessageReceivedCallbacks

        public void removeMessageReceivedCallbacks(FlintManager manager,
                                           java.lang.String namespace)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Flint.FlintApi
        Remove message received callback function from this controller for a given namespace.
        Specified by:
        removeMessageReceivedCallbacks in interface Flint.FlintApi
        Parameters:
        manager - Flint manager with which to perform this request.
        namespace - used namespace
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while performing the request.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If namespace is null or empty.
